name: The Desk-Edge Pec Opener
desc: Place forearm on the edge of your desk. Rotate your body away. Keep your shoulder down and back.

name: Seated 'Figure-4' Glute Stretch
desc: Sit at the edge of your chair. Cross ankle over knee. Lean forward with a flat back. Do this every hour.

name: The Stealth Hip Lift
desc: While sitting, lift one buttock off the chair using only your side-waist muscles. Alternate side to side.

name: Towel Overhead Reach
desc: Hold a towel tight between hands. Reach overhead and pull the towel apart. Opens the chest and lats.

name: The 'Meeting' Neck Glide
desc: Move your head forward and backward (like a pigeon) without tilting up or down. Greases the neck discs.

name: Under-Table Ankle 8s
desc: Draw a figure-8 with your toes under the desk. Prevents ankle stiffness during long calls.

name: The Chair-Assisted Thoracic Twist
desc: Sit sideways on a chair. Use the backrest to pull yourself into a deeper spinal rotation.

name: Finger Splay Isometrics
desc: Press all fingers flat against the desk. Try to lift only your ring finger. It's harder than it looks.

name: The 'Invisible' Standing Calf Raise
desc: Stand in line. Lift heels 1 inch. Hold for 30s. Nobody will notice your calves are on fire.

name: Towel Behind-Back Pass
desc: Hold towel with one hand over shoulder, one hand behind back. Try to 'walk' hands closer together.

name: Seated Leg Extension (Hidden)
desc: Straighten your leg under the desk. Flex your quad hard for 10s. Keep the knee joint healthy.

name: The 'Phone Neck' Counter
desc: Interlace fingers behind head. Push head back into hands while hands resist. Reset your posture.

name: Wall-Supported Hip Airplane
desc: Hand on wall for balance. Hinge on one leg. Rotate your hips open and closed. Critical for hip health.

name: The 'Secret' Glute Squeeze
desc: Squeeze glutes as hard as possible while standing. Hold 10s. Prevents 'gluteal amnesia' from sitting.

name: Wrist Extension (Desk Press)
desc: Press palms into the underside of the desk as if trying to lift it. Stretches the top of the wrist.

name: The 'Pencil' Foot Grab
desc: Try to pick up a pencil or towel with your toes. Builds the intrinsic muscles of the arch.

name: Seated Pelvic Tilt (Stealth)
desc: Small, controlled tilts of the pelvis while sitting. Keeps the lower back from locking up.

name: The Doorway 'Y' Stretch
desc: Place hands high on a doorway. Lean through. Reverses the 'keyboard hunch' instantly.

name: Towel Lat Pull-down
desc: Hold towel overhead. Pull it down to your chest while pulling hands outward. Squeeze the shoulder blades.

name: Standing Single-Leg Balance (Eyes Closed)
desc: The ultimate test. Stand on one leg and close your eyes. Try for 30 seconds.

name: The 'Thinker' Neck Stretch
desc: Rest chin on hand. Gently push head back and to the side. Targets the deep sub-occipitals.

name: Seated Windshield Wipers
desc: Sit at the edge. Keep feet wide. Drop knees inward one at a time. Hip internal rotation.

name: The 'Caffeine' Shoulder Roll
desc: Huge, slow shoulder circles. Imagine you are massaging your own traps with your shoulder blades.

name: Towel Hamstring Floss
desc: Lie on back. Loop towel over foot. Straighten and bend the knee. Flosses the nerve and muscle.

name: Wall Slide (W to V)
desc: Back against wall. Move arms from a 'W' shape to a 'V' shape. Keep elbows and wrists touching wall.

name: The 'Coffee' Wrist Circle
desc: Hold an imaginary mug. Rotate the wrist in a full circle without spilling the 'coffee'.

name: Seated Hip Flexor Lift
desc: While sitting, lift your knee toward your chest without leaning back. Hold 5s. Switch.

name: The 'Stair' Calf Stretch
desc: Heels hanging off a step. Let gravity pull them down. The most effective calf stretch on earth.

name: Towel Archer Reach
desc: Hold towel. Reach one arm up, one down. Switch with speed. Dynamic shoulder coordination.

name: The 'Zoom' Ribcage Shift
desc: Slide your ribs left and right while keeping your head and hips still. Great for spinal fluidity.

name: Wall-Supported Prying Squat
desc: Deep squat with back against wall. Use elbows to push knees out. Hold for 60 seconds.

name: The 'Hidden' Toe Splay
desc: Inside your shoes, spread your toes as wide as possible. Hold 5s. Do it 10 times.

name: Seated Thoracic Extension
desc: Interlace fingers behind neck. Use the top of the chair back as a fulcrum to lean back and open.

name: The 'Keyboard' Wrist Shake
desc: Every 30 mins: shake hands vigorously for 20s. Resets the nervous system and blood flow.

name: Towel Steering Wheel
desc: Hold towel taut in front of you. Rotate it like a steering wheel. Coordination for the shoulders.

name: The 'Subway' Balance
desc: Stand on one leg while the bus/train is moving. Use your core to stabilize. (Don't fall!)

name: Seated Cat-Cow (Small)
desc: Round and arch your spine while sitting. Focus on the very lower segments of the back.

name: The 'Waiters' Bow
desc: Stand. Hinge at hips with a flat back. Keep knees slightly bent. Feel the hamstrings.

name: Wall Pec Stretch (Arm Straight)
desc: Hand flat on wall, arm straight. Rotate your body away. Stretch from the chest through the bicep.

name: Towel Shin Stretch
desc: Sit on floor. Loop towel over the TOP of your toes. Pull back to stretch the front of the shin.

name: The 'Ear-to-Shoulder' Ripple
desc: Tilt head to shoulder. Now imagine the stretch rippling all the way down to your fingertips.

name: Seated Glute Medius Squeeze
desc: Place your hands on the outside of your knees. Push knees out while hands resist. 10s hold.

name: The 'L-Sit' Chair Press
desc: Hands on armrests. Push yourself up so your butt clears the seat. Keep knees bent to start.

name: Wall-Facing Squat
desc: Stand 2 inches from a wall. Squat deep without your face or knees touching the wall. Mobility test!

name: Towel Tricep Reach
desc: One hand over, one under. Use the top hand to pull the bottom arm up into a shoulder stretch.

name: The 'Stiff' Neck Look-Away
desc: Look as far left as possible. Now use your eyes to look even further. Your neck will follow.

name: Seated Adductor Squeeze
desc: Place a fist between your knees. Squeeze your knees together as hard as possible. 10s hold.

name: The 'Hanging' Forward Fold
desc: Stand. Fold forward. Let your head be a heavy weight that pulls your spine longer.

name: Wall-Supported Quad Stretch
desc: Stand facing away from wall. Place top of foot on wall. Sink into a lunge. Intense hip opener.

name: Towel Chest Pull
desc: Hold towel behind your back. Pull it away from your body and upward. Squeeze the blades.

name: The 'Clock' Head Rotation
desc: Imagine your nose is the hand of a clock. Touch every hour mark with a slow, smooth circle.

name: Seated Ankle Eversion
desc: While sitting, lift your foot and try to turn the sole outward. Strengthens the peroneal muscles.

name: The 'Tabletop' Wrist Stretch
desc: Place backs of hands on the desk, fingers pointing toward you. Lean back gently. Wrist relief.

name: Wall 'Snow Angels'
desc: Back against wall. Move arms up and down in a full arc. Keep shoulders and elbows touching wall.

name: Towel Foot Scrunches
desc: Place towel on floor. Use your toes to scrunch it up toward you. Build that arch!

name: The 'Nod' of Health
desc: Very small, very fast 'Yes' and 'No' nods. Loosens the top-most vertebra (C1-C2).

name: Seated Spine Extension (Active)
desc: Sit tall. Reach for the sky. Imagine you are being pulled up by a string from your crown.

name: The 'Hidden' Calf Stretch
desc: While standing, step one foot back. Press the heel down. Do this while talking to someone.

name: Wall-Supported Side Bend
desc: Stand sideways to wall. Reach arm over and touch the wall. Stretch the entire lateral chain.

name: Towel Resistance Neck Extension
desc: Loop towel behind head. Pull towel forward while pushing head back. Build neck strength.

name: The 'Pelvic Clock'
desc: Seated. Imagine your pelvis is on a clock face. Tilt to 12, 6, 3, and 9. Spinal lubrication.

name: Seated 'Big Toe' Yoga
desc: Lift only the big toe while sitting. Then only the small toes. Brain-foot connection.

name: The 'Doorframe' Lat Stretch
desc: Grab the side of a doorway and lean your hips away. Breathe into the side of your ribs.

name: Wall-Facing Scapular Slides
desc: Forearms on wall in a V. Slide them up while keeping your shoulder blades pulled down.

name: Towel Bicep Isometrics
desc: Step on a towel. Hold the ends and pull up as hard as possible. 10s maximum effort.

name: The 'Stealth' Scapular Squeeze
desc: Try to touch your elbows behind your back while typing. Opens the chest instantly.

name: Seated Leg Swings (Small)
desc: Lift one leg. Swing the lower leg back and forth. Lubricates the knee joint.

name: The 'Stair' Toe Raise
desc: Balls of feet on step. Pull toes up toward shins. Strengthens the tibialis muscle.

name: Wall-Supported Warrior III
desc: Hands on wall. Hinge until torso is parallel. Lift one leg. Great for spine alignment.

name: Towel Glute Bridge
desc: Lie on back. Squeeze a rolled-up towel between your knees while performing a bridge.

name: The 'Jaw' Slide
desc: Gently move your lower jaw side to side. Releases tension from stress and grinding.

name: Seated Internal Hip Rotation
desc: Sit with feet wide. Drop one knee toward the center. Hold 5s. Switch. Hip maintenance.

name: The 'Wall' Chest Smash
desc: Lean your chest into a wall corner. Use the corner to massage the pec-shoulder junction.

name: Towel 'Figure-8' Coordination
desc: Move a towel in a figure-8 pattern using both hands. Increases shoulder fluidity.

name: The 'Infinite' Neck Ripple
desc: Imagine a wave starting at your nose and traveling down to your tailbone. Liquid movement.

name: Seated Quadricep Isometric
desc: Straighten leg, lock knee. Squeeze quad as hard as you can for 10s. Knee protection.

name: The 'Desk' Tricep Stretch
desc: Place elbows on desk, hands on back of neck. Sink your head between your arms.

name: Wall-Supported Cossack Squat
desc: Use the wall for balance. Perform a deep side lunge. The wall lets you stay upright.

name: Towel Overhead Lunge
desc: Hold towel tight overhead. Perform a lunge. Forces the core to stabilize the spine.

name: The 'Stealth' Belly Breath
desc: Breathe so only your stomach expands. Calm the nervous system during a stressful day.

name: Seated 'Windmill' Reach
desc: Sit wide. Reach one hand to opposite foot, other to sky. Rotate the middle back.

name: The 'Wall' Calf Smash
desc: Place your heel against the wall and your toes high up the wall. Lean in. Deep stretch.

name: Towel Behind-Back Extension
desc: Hold towel behind back. Lift it as high as possible without leaning forward.

name: The 'Alphabet' Wrist Riddle
desc: Write the alphabet with your closed fist. Moves the wrist through every angle.

name: Seated 'Hollow Body' Hold
desc: At the edge of chair, lean back slightly, lift feet. Hold the 'V' shape for 20s.

name: The 'Desk' Cat-Cow
desc: Hands on desk. Round your back and push away, then arch and pull your chest forward.

name: Wall-Supported Scorpion
desc: Stand facing wall. Kick one leg back and rotate it across. Opens the hip and spine.

name: Towel Shoulder Dislocates
desc: Hold towel wide. Move it from your hips, over your head, to your lower back. Slow.

name: The 'Stealth' Neck Rotation
desc: Slowly look as far left as possible. Hold 5s. Now look right. Keep chin level.

name: Seated Hamstring Reach
desc: One leg straight out. Reach for your toes. Keep your back as flat as possible.

name: The 'Wall' Lat Reach
desc: Stand sideways. Reach arm high and press palm into wall. Lean away. Side-body relief.

name: Towel Pelvic Squeeze
desc: Sit. Place towel between knees. Squeeze and lift your pelvic floor. Stability foundation.

name: The 'Stealth' Shoulder Shrug
desc: Pull shoulders to ears, then pull them down to your 'back pockets'. Reset posture.

name: Seated Ribcage Circles
desc: Try to move only your ribs in a circle while sitting. Keeps the mid-spine mobile.

name: The 'Wall' Ankle Rock
desc: Toes against wall. Drive knee toward the wall. Increases ankle range for better walking.

name: Towel Isometric Row
desc: Loop towel around a post (or your feet). Pull as hard as possible for 10s.

name: The 'Stealth' Jaw Release
desc: Open your mouth slightly and move your jaw in a slow circle. Releases stress tension.

name: Seated Hip External Rotation
desc: Cross ankle over knee. Gently push the knee toward the floor. Opens the hip socket.

name: The 'Wall' Spine Roll
desc: Back against wall. Peel your spine off the wall one vertebra at a time until you hang.

name: The 'Final Integration' Shake
desc: Stand up. Shake your whole body for 30 seconds. Feel the blood move everywhere.
